intro: Markleya, commonly known as the marsh hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the Gulf Coast regions. The plants typically have showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They are often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Markleya species are herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, sandy soils and are adapted to coastal environments.
